main.div: Inserts the given text or element(s) as sibling after each element of this list. If a string has been given, it will be added as text node. If you pass an element or a list, it will be inserted only after of the first element of the list. In order to add elements to several list items, you need to pass a factory function(element, index) thats creates new instances for each item. The function will be invoked for each element and may return either a string for a text node, a simple HTML element or a list containing both.

Use addAfter() with a simple string to add a text node. $('#mainText').addAfter('Disclaimer: bla bla bla'); This results in the following HTML:
Here is some text Disclaimer: bla bla bla

You can also pass an element, but note that a node can only be added once to the first list item, even if the list has more than one item: $('#mainText').addAfter(EE('span', {'className': 'disclaimer'}, 'Disclaimer: bla bla bla')); With the previous example's HTML, this would create this:
Disclaimer: bla bla bla WARNING

Lists of elements and nodes are possible as well. Like nodes, it will only be added to the first list item.
$('#status').addAfter([EE('hr'), 'Disclaimer']);
